topics.body:
Wow the fun never ends with Ukraine.
Also during the last Financial Crisis, why didn't the US declare bankruptcy? I thought that if they declared bankruptcy they could pay off a certain amount that they can cover without further increasing their debt. 
Also the level of debt in the US was like what 19 trillion US or 20+ I can't recall since it was a few years back.

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e96b7d63687273dc1e0100#post_53e96b7d63687273dc1e0100
Cause declaring bankruptcy is really bad for a country.  If the USA were to declare bankruptcy we're talking complete global economic collapse.


Also deficit isn't that bad; runaway inflation is what's bad and when you declare bankruptcy is what's bad.

Okay, well I guess that's going to end wonderfully. Though isn't it going to take decades if not a century to pay something like that off?
[/bq]
It's totally going to take ages to pay off the deficit; personally I think it'll take fifty years to pay off fully.  It's not that big of a deal to be honest; think of it as like paying off your car as long as you can meet your monthly minimum payments you're golden.  Sure in this case the deficit is going to take a long time to pay off, but so long as we meet our minimum payments we're golden.

topics.body:
Son of a fucking whore ass cunt bitch!

I literally have the laziest fucking team in programming; I have done everything. . . LITERALLY EVERYTHING in the group project except find one bug.  I've spent 14 fucking hours and they're that fucking lazy that they refuse to find one bug that I can't seem to find.  Bitch pussy ass fuck shit cunt dildo boulderdash.
!http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/412/985/490.jpg!
I'm really fucking mad cause the project is due tomorrow and they refuse to find one error; one fucking error and we're done.  I'm not asking for them to program a entire program; all I'm asking is for them to find the extra bracket.


If you want to know how fucking lazy this is programming wise there's these things called functions; basically they tell the program "oh hey I'm about to do this computation so hold off on the rest of the program for a bit".  The way you do this is name_of_function { what you want to do }  If you accidentally have a extra bracket i.e name_of_function { { what you want to do } instead it'll return a error.  All I want them to do is find out where the extra bracket is and they're that fucking lazy.
